job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities - Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs - Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented - Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation - Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them - Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams - Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams - Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle - Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements - Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation - Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines - Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details - Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation - Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: For inquiries, email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for development alignment. Supports testing and ensures traceable, up-to-date requirements.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role, not a screen updater role, and not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation (BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, acceptance criteria).
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.

Success Metrics

  • Clear, testable requirements with zero rework.
  • Strong cross-team alignment and confident communication.
  • Alignment with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst.
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments.
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems.
  • Ability to run independent client workshops.
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle.

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling and system reasoning to deliver clear, testable requirements. Requires 4+ years of experience with expertise in SaaS environments and strong analytical skills.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

About the Role We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and guide teams toward a secure-by-design culture.

Key Responsibilities - Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments. - Conduct security risk assessments, perform vulnerability scans, coordinate penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans. - Architect, maintain, and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints. - Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering, ensuring secure design and development practices. - Continuously monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies. - Develop and mature Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks. - Design and lead secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments. - Build, operate, and secure containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes with enforced security baselines. - Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and application layers. - Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads. - Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence. - Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution. - Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience - 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure. - Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions). - Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture. - Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code using Terraform, Ansible, or similar tools. - Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments. - Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers). - Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks). - Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM). - Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell). - Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills. - Strong communication and collaboration abilities to influence engineering teams.

How to Apply If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, share your updated resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation, guiding secure-by-design practices across cloud and on-prem environments.

job_description:
L2 SOC Security Analyst

Location: From Kochi Office (Onsite) Office: ART Technologies and Software

Job Summary:

The L2 Security Analyst is responsible for performing advanced incident analysis, investigating security escalations from L1 analysts, conducting vulnerability assessments, and actively supporting threat hunting and malware analysis. This role acts as a critical link within the SOC by coordinating incident response efforts, ensuring compliance with security frameworks, and enhancing the organization's cybersecurity posture through diligent monitoring and remediation activities.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor, analyze, and respond to alerts generated by firewalls, proxy servers, and intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS).
  • Perform rule tuning and assist in configuration adjustments of firewall, proxy, and IDS devices.
  • Handle escalations from L1 analysts and conduct in-depth investigations of security incidents and alerts.
  • Perform comprehensive log analysis, root cause analysis, threat hunting, and forensic examinations.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders across IT, security, and business units to implement incident response and remediation.
  • Execute vulnerability assessments using tools like Nessus and Qualys; manage patching activities in coordination with relevant teams.
  • Participate in continuous threat hunting exercises and malware analysis to identify emerging threats.
  • Ensure adherence to security policies, standards, and regulatory frameworks such as ISO 27001, PCI DSS, and GDPR.
  • Maintain and update incident response playbooks; contribute to SOC process improvements.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring to L1 analysts.
  • Prepare detailed incident reports and documentation for stakeholders.

Required Experience and Qualifications:

  • 2 to 5 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, SOC, or IT infrastructure security.
  • Proven expertise with SIEM platforms (e.g., Splunk, QRadar), endpoint protection, and threat detection solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with vulnerability management tools such as Nessus, Qualys, or equivalent.
  • Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance requirements (ISO 27001, PCI DSS, GDPR preferred).
  • Relevant security certifications such as CEH, CompTIA Security+, or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  • Effective communication skills with ability to liaise across technical and non-technical teams.

Preferred Skills:

  • Knowledge of malware analysis and computer forensic techniques.
  • Experience with scripting languages (Python, Bash) for automation and security tool enhancement.
  • Understanding of network security protocols and firewall management.
  • Ability to work collaboratively under pressure in a fast-paced, 24/7 operational environment.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at lavanya.a@arttechgroup.com.
summary: The L2 SOC Security Analyst role involves advanced incident analysis, threat hunting, and compliance with security frameworks. Requires 2-5 years of cybersecurity experience and expertise in SIEM platforms and vulnerability management tools.

job_title: QA Engineer - AI Accuracy & Validation Testing
job_description:
QA Engineer - AI Accuracy & Validation Testing

We are seeking a QA Engineer to join our AI Quality Assurance team, focusing on accuracy, robustness, reliability, and ethical validation of AI/ML and Generative AI systems. This role goes beyond traditional QA and involves testing non-deterministic, data-driven, and probabilistic AI outputs.

Key Responsibilities

AI-Specific Testing Responsibilities - Perform accuracy, validation, and consistency testing for AI/ML and Generative AI applications - Test non-deterministic systems where the same input may produce different outputs - Define and validate probabilistic acceptance criteria instead of fixed expected results - Conduct model robustness testing using noisy, edge-case, and adversarial inputs - Identify and report hallucinations in Generative AI (LLMs, chatbots, NLP systems) - Perform prompt testing and prompt regression testing to ensure stable AI responses after model or prompt updates - Validate explainability and justification of AI outputs (why a model produced a specific result) - Execute fairness, bias, and ethical testing to detect skewed, unsafe, or discriminatory AI behaviour

Manual & Automation Testing - Design and execute manual test cases for AI workflows, edge cases, and real-world scenarios - Validate AI outputs against datasets, expected patterns, statistical thresholds, and business rules - Develop and maintain automation scripts using Selenium with Python for AI-driven workflows - Automate repetitive AI accuracy, regression, and validation tests - Perform regression testing after model retraining, fine-tuning, or data updates

Collaboration & Documentation - Work closely with AI/ML engineers and data teams to understand models, prompts, inputs, and outputs - Analyse incorrect or inconsistent AI responses and log high-quality, detailed defects - Work with structured and unstructured data (text, images, datasets) for testing - Document test results, observations, risks, and AI improvement recommendations - Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and sprint QA activities

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Completed QA training in Manual and Automation Testing
  • Strong understanding of testing fundamentals, SDLC, and STLC
  • Mandatory Python knowledge (academic projects or professional experience)
  • Mandatory experience or training in Selenium with Python
  • Ability to understand and test data-driven, logic-based, and AI-powered systems
  • Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
  • Good verbal and written communication skills

Good to Have

  • Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts (models, datasets, accuracy, precision, recall, etc.)
  • Exposure to testing AI/ML applications, chatbots, NLP systems, LLMs, or recommendation engines
  • Familiarity with PyTest or other Python-based automation frameworks
  • Knowledge of test data preparation, validation, and labelling
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology
  • Awareness of AI ethics, bias, and responsible AI principles

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at joinus@pearlsofttechnologies.com.
summary: QA Engineer to validate AI/ML systems' accuracy, robustness, and ethics using Python and Selenium automation.

About Us

We are a fast-growing, product-based company developing a multi-organization ERP and CRM platform for the education sector. Our solutions help schools, colleges, and universities streamline operations, improve collaboration, and manage multiple campuses efficiently. With a strong focus on usability, scalability, and innovation, we enable educational institutions to operate smarter and deliver better outcomes.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Senior SEO Specialist with 4+ years of experience to drive our international search visibility across multiple regions and platforms. This role focuses on global SEO strategy, Generative Engine Optimization (GEO), technical SEO, authoritative content creation, and high-quality link building.

Key Responsibilities

  1. International & Multi-Regional SEO
  2. Manage and optimize SEO for international domains (ccTLDs, subdomains, or subdirectories), including complex hreflang implementations.
  3. Monitor and execute global search trends to maintain visibility across time zones and cultural contexts.

  4. Conduct market-specific keyword research to capture regional search intent and cultural nuances.

  5. Generative Engine Optimization (GEO)

  6. Optimize website architecture and content to rank in AI-driven search engines and "AI Overviews".

  7. Focus on brand citations, entity authority, and semantic relevance for LLM (Large Language Model) recommendations.

  8. High-Impact Outreach & Link Building

  9. Lead international outreach campaigns to acquire high-authority backlinks from global publications and niche-specific sites.

  10. Build relationships with international webmasters and influencers for a diverse, high-quality link profile.

  11. Technical Content Writing

  12. Produce and edit technical content (whitepapers, blogs, documentation) that is SEO-friendly and authoritative.

  13. Translate complex technical features into clear, benefit-driven copy for global developers and B2B decision-makers.

  14. Technical & On-Page SEO

  15. Conduct site health audits focusing on Core Web Vitals, schema markup (JSON-LD), and crawlability.
  16. Collaborate with dev teams to implement technical recommendations across international subdomains.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience: 4+ years in a dedicated SEO role with international project management experience.
  • GEO Mastery: Deep understanding of AI engine optimization and "citatability".
  • Content Prowess: Exceptional technical writing skills in English (human-first, SEO-second).
  • Technical Stack: Proficiency in GA4, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Semrush, Screaming Frog, WordPress, and SEO tools.
  • Outreach: Experience with BuzzStream, Hunter.io, or manual PR outreach.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Familiarity with HTML/CSS/JavaScript for SEO performance.
  • Certification in Advanced SEO or Google Analytics.

Apply via Career Estrrado or send your resume to career@estrrado.com with the subject line: SEO Specialist.

Tools & Methodologies - Git, Jira - Agile/Scrum development practices - Unit & integration testing

Leadership & Soft Skills - Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills - Ability to manage ambiguity and complex requirements - Excellent communication and stakeholder management - Proven experience leading teams and meeting delivery timelines - Business-oriented mindset with focus on outcomes and value delivery

Good to Have - Cloud deployment experience (AWS/Azure/GCP) - Basic awareness of AI/ML and tools like ChatGPT - Performance testing and optimization experience - Exposure to CI/CD pipelines

job_description:

Way.com — America’s dominant automotive super app, powering every mile for over 10 million customers—from auto insurance and parking to EV charging and more. Leveraging cutting-edge AI, machine learning, and advanced data analytics, we deliver innovative, personalized solutions that transform car ownership. Featured by Bloomberg and ranked 48th on Andreessen Horowitz’s Marketplace list of fastest-growing companies worldwide and recognized as the top Product in Insurance by UnitQ, we’re making car ownership easier, more affordable, and more rewarding.

On-site

6 - 9 years

Full-time

We are seeking a Senior Node.js & React.js Developer with strong hands-on experience in building scalable, high-performance web applications. This role requires technical leadership, deep problem-solving skills, and ownership of end-to-end feature delivery while mentoring junior engineers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct code reviews and enforce engineering best practices
  • Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance
  • Collaborate with Product, UX, QA, and DevOps teams
  • Drive technical decisions and participate in architectural discussions
  • Troubleshoot complex production issues and perform root-cause analysis

Preferred Skills

  • 6–9 years of experience in JavaScript-based full-stack development

  • Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3

Good to Have

  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of Next.js or Server-Side Rendering concepts
  • Familiarity with unit and integration testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha)

Why You Will Love Working with Us

  • Opportunity to work for the #1 Auto Super app in the US

  • Clear pathways for career growth in a rapidly scaling technology company
